Package patchwork

Class Patchwork

java.lang.Object
patchwork.Patchwork
public class Patchwork extends Object
The Patchwork class represents the patchwork board of a player in the Patchwork game. It consists of a 9x9 grid of Patches and tracks completed rows and columns.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Patchwork()
    Constructs a new Patchwork object with an empty 9x9 grid and no completed rows or columns.

  • Method Details

    • openPatch

      public boolean openPatch(Patch patch)
      Checks if a given patch is available to be placed on the patchwork board.
      Parameters:
      patch - The patch to check.
      Returns:
      True if the patch can be placed, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the patch is null.

    • getFullRows

      public int getFullRows()
      Gets the number of completed rows on the patchwork board.
      Returns:
      The number of completed rows.

    • getFullCols

      public int getFullCols()
      Gets the number of completed columns on the patchwork board.
      Returns:
      The number of completed columns.

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Checks if the patchwork board is complete (all 81 patches have been placed).
      Returns:
      True if the board is complete, false otherwise.

    • addToPatchwork

      public boolean addToPatchwork(Player player, Patch piece, int row, int col)
      Adds the given piece to the player's patchwork.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who owns the patchwork.
      piece - The piece to add.
      row - The row to place the piece in.
      col - The column to place the piece in.
      Returns:
      True if the piece was added successfully, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player or piece is null, or if the row or column is out of bounds.

    • movePiece

      public boolean movePiece(Patch piece, int currentX, int currentY, int newX, int newY)
      Moves the given piece to a new position on the patchwork board.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece to move.
      currentX - The current x-coordinate of the piece.
      currentY - The current y-coordinate of the piece.
      newX - The new x-coordinate to move the piece to.
      newY - The new y-coordinate to move the piece to.
      Returns:
      True if the piece was moved successfully, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the piece is null or if the coordinates are out of bounds.

    • getPlacedPieces

      public List<Patch> getPlacedPieces()
      Returns a list of all placed pieces on the patchwork board.
      Returns:
      A list of placed pieces.

    • getPieceX

      public int getPieceX(Patch piece)
      Returns the x-coordinate of the given piece on the patchwork board.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece to find the x-coordinate of.
      Returns:
      The x-coordinate of the piece, or -1 if the piece is not found.

    • getPieceY

      public int getPieceY(Patch piece)
      Returns the y-coordinate of the given piece on the patchwork board.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece to find the y-coordinate of.
      Returns:
      The y-coordinate of the piece, or -1 if the piece is not found.
